__inputs.name: DS_PROMETHEUS
__inputs.label: prometheus
__inputs.description: Prometheus data source for EmailEngine metrics

description: Monitoring dashboard for EmailEngine - email API gateway. Tracks worker health, API usage, webhook delivery, queue processing, IMAP connections, and Redis performance.

panels.description: Time since EmailEngine process started. A recent restart may indicate crashes or deployments.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Currently running EmailEngine version.
panels.title: Version

panels.description: Node.js runtime version.
panels.title: Node.js

panels.description: Redis server version used for data storage.
panels.title: Redis

panels.description: Configured number of IMAP worker threads for handling email account connections.
panels.title: IMAP Workers

panels.description: Configured number of webhook worker threads for delivering notifications.
panels.title: Webhook Workers

panels.description: Number of worker threads not responding to health checks. Non-zero values indicate stuck or crashed workers that may need attention.
panels.title: Unresponsive

panels.description: Days until license expires. -1 indicates active license without fixed expiry (lifetime or subscription). 0 means no active license. Low values trigger color warnings for renewal.
panels.title: License

panels.description: Active worker threads grouped by type (imap/webhooks) and age (recent = started within last 5 minutes). High churn in 'recent' workers may indicate instability.
panels.title: Worker Threads by Type

panels.description: Rate of worker thread starts and stops. High stop rates may indicate crashes or resource issues. Starts should roughly match stops during normal operation.
panels.title: Thread Lifecycle

panels.description: Process memory consumption. RSS is total memory used. Heap shows V8 JavaScript engine memory. Growing heap without plateau may indicate memory leaks.
panels.title: Process Memory

panels.description: CPU time spent in user mode. Values close to 1.0 indicate full utilization of one CPU core. Sustained high values may require scaling.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: API request rate grouped by HTTP method. Shows the distribution of read (GET) vs write (POST/PUT/DELETE) operations.
panels.title: Requests by Method

panels.description: API response status codes. 2xx = success, 4xx = client errors (bad requests), 5xx = server errors. Monitor 5xx for application issues.
panels.title: Responses by Status Code

panels.description: Webhook delivery outcomes. 'success' means the target server accepted the webhook. 'fail' indicates delivery failures that may be retried.
panels.title: Delivery Status

panels.description: Webhook rate by event type. Shows which events generate the most webhook traffic (messageNew, messageDeleted, etc.).
panels.title: Events by Type

panels.description: Distribution of webhook HTTP request durations. Darker colors indicate more requests at that latency. Long response times may indicate slow webhook endpoints.
panels.title: Request Latency

panels.description: Webhook notification queue size by state. 'waiting' = pending delivery, 'active' = currently processing, 'delayed' = scheduled for retry.
panels.title: Webhook Queue

panels.description: Webhook job processing outcomes. 'completed' = successfully delivered, 'failed' = permanent failure after retries.
panels.title: Webhook Processing

panels.description: Email sending queue size. Shows outbound emails waiting to be sent via SMTP.
panels.title: Email Sending Queue

panels.description: Email sending job outcomes. Monitor 'failed' for SMTP delivery issues.
panels.title: Email Sending Processing

panels.description: Live account connection states from worker threads (IMAP and API backends). 'connected' = active sessions, 'connecting' = establishing connections, 'authenticationError' = credential issues, 'connectError' = network/server issues.
panels.title: Account States

panels.description: IMAP server response types. OK = successful commands, NO = rejected commands, BAD = protocol errors. High NO/BAD rates indicate issues.
panels.title: Response Codes

panels.description: IMAP network traffic. Shows bytes sent to and received from email servers. High traffic indicates active synchronization or large email downloads.
panels.title: Network Bandwidth

panels.description: Internal events fired by EmailEngine. Shows activity levels for different event types like messageNew, messageDeleted, etc.
panels.title: Events

panels.description: OAuth2 access token refresh attempts by provider and status. Failures indicate issues with refresh tokens or OAuth2 provider connectivity.
panels.title: Token Refresh

panels.description: OAuth2 API request rates by provider and status (MS Graph, Gmail API). Failures indicate API errors or connectivity issues.
panels.title: API Requests

panels.description: OAuth2 API failures grouped by HTTP status code. Helps identify specific error types (401=auth, 403=permissions, 429=rate limit, 5xx=server errors).
panels.title: API Failures by Status Code

panels.description: Redis memory currently in use for data storage.
panels.title: Memory Used

panels.description: Maximum memory Redis can use (maxmemory setting).
panels.title: Memory Limit

panels.description: Number of active Redis client connections from EmailEngine.
panels.title: Clients

panels.description: Redis commands processed per second.
panels.title: Throughput

panels.description: Redis PING latency in nanoseconds. High values (>10ms) indicate network issues or Redis overload.
panels.title: Latency

panels.description: Number of slow commands in Redis slowlog. Non-zero values may indicate performance issues.
panels.title: Slowlog

panels.description: Time since Redis server started.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Last time Redis saved data to disk (RDB snapshot).
panels.title: Last Save

panels.description: Percentage of Redis memory limit in use. Approaching 100% may cause evictions or OOM errors.
panels.title: Memory Usage %

panels.description: Percentage of Redis max connections in use.
panels.title: Connection Pool Usage

panels.description: Cache hit ratio. Higher is better. Low ratios may indicate inefficient key access patterns.
panels.title: Cache Hit Ratio

panels.description: Average time per Redis command. Should be sub-millisecond. High values indicate slow commands.
panels.title: Average Command Time

panels.description: Total keys stored in Redis by database.
panels.title: Key Count

panels.description: Rate of keys evicted due to memory pressure. Non-zero values indicate Redis is running out of memory.
panels.title: Key Evictions

title: EmailEngine
